title: The Future of AI on Campus
excerpt: A deep dive into how machine learning is optimizing our library systems.
paragraphs: Artificial Intelligence is often seen as a distant future technology, but on our campus, it is already happening. The new library system implemented last month uses basic ML algorithms to sort books.
I spoke with the Dean regarding this shift. He mentioned that efficiency has increased by 40% since the deployment. Students can now find research papers in seconds rather than minutes.

However, there were challenges. The initial dataset was messy, leading to some hilarious misclassifications. For example, 'The C++ Programming Language' was briefly categorized under 'Foreign Languages'.
The team is now working on phase two: facial recognition for entry. This has raised some privacy concerns among the student body, which the administration promises to address in the next town hall.

images.caption: The new automated kiosk at the Central Library.
Graph showing the efficiency increase over 3 months.
